oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 132 Second Avenue North architectural survey, circa 1976-1994
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Architecture; Buildings; Business; Capitol City; Downtown Nashville; Architectural surveys--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture--Details; Architecture--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture, Victorian--Tennessee--Nashville; Buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Central business districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Commercial buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic preservation--Tennessee--Nashville; History--Societies, etc.--Tennessee--Nashville
Nashville (Tenn.)--Buildings, structures, etc.; Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Second Avenue (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Detailed architectural and historical survey of the building located at 132 Second Avenue North, consisting of photographs and documents created from around 1976 to 1994. Black and white photographs are of the exterior front or street view of the building, with some views from an angle to the side, often showing adjacent buildings. Documents contain architectural descriptions, compilations of deed and city directory research, and other research notes. This building was built around 1885. It is made of brick and is three stories tall. Corbeled brick relief arches with stone caps form the window openings on the second and third floors. Some photographs show old faded signage for Dudley Bros. hardware firm. Forms part of Historic Nashville Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Historic Nashville, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church St., Nashville, Tennessee 37219
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Historic Nashville, Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey
